summary: england coach john peacock has named his squad for next month 's uefa european under-17 championship in bulgaria . the young lions are the defending champions , having beaten holland on penalties in the final last year , and progressed to this edition with a 100 per cent record in qualifying . they have been placed in group d alongside holland , italy and the republic of ireland this time around and will open their campaign against italy in burgas on may 7 .

aspect: - England Under-17 squad for the UEFA European Championship has been announced.
- Chelsea's Jay Dasilva is included in the squad.
- Liverpool's Herbie Kane and Trent Arnold have been recalled.
- Arsenal duo Chris Willock and Stephy Mavididi have been called up for the first time.
- The squad includes talented young players from Premier League clubs.
- England will face Italy, Holland, and Ireland in the group stage.
- Their matches are against Holland on May 10 and Ireland on May 13.
explain: England Under-17 squad for the UEFA European Championship has been announced.

The given aspect highlights the inclusion of Chelsea's Jay Dasilva in the England squad for the UEFA European Under-17 Championship. Dasilva is a talented young defender who has been named in the squad despite his young age. His inclusion in the squad is likely to be seen as a positive sign for the future of English football, given his potential for development and improvement. His inclusion in the squad also highlights the strength of the English squad, who are the defending champions and are considered favorites to win the tournament once again.

The aspect of the Liverpool's Herbie Kane and Trent Arnold being recalled is highlighting that the duo, who played a crucial role in England's Under-17 World Cup win last year, have been selected for the team once again for the upcoming UEFA European Under-17 Championship, which will be held in Bulgaria.
The given aspect highlights that Arsenal duo Chris Willock and Stephy Mavididi have been called up for the first time by England coach John Peacock for the UEFA European Under-17 Championship.

The aspect highlights that the England U17 squad has talented young players from Premier League clubs. These players are likely to have developed their skills through the academies and youth systems of their respective clubs, and have been identified as having potential for international success. The presence of these talented young players in the squad is likely to increase the chances of England successfully defending their title.

The given aspect is mentioning the teams that England will face in the group stage of the UEFA European Under-17 Championship. Holland, Italy, and Ireland are the three teams that England will be competing against in their group. This was previously mentioned in the summary where the Young Lions' opponents in the group stage were mentioned to be Holland, Italy, and Ireland.

The aspect highlights the matches that England's under-17 football team will play in the UEFA European Under-17 Championship against Holland on May 10 and Ireland on May 13. The team will defend their title they won last year against Holland in the final. They have already qualified for the tournament with a 100% record in the qualifying rounds and are placed in Group D alongside Holland, Italy, and Ireland. These matches will be crucial for the team's progress in the tournament.

The Young Lions are the defending champions, having beaten Holland on penalties in the final last year and progressed to this edition with a 100 per cent record in qualifying. They have been placed in Group D alongside Holland, Italy, and the Republic of Ireland this time around and will open their campaign against Italy in Burgas on May 7.
